headline: Digital Realty raises annual core FFO, revenue forecasts on data center services demand
summary: Digital Realty has been benefiting from a surge in demand as more enterprises upgrade and outsource their IT infrastructure, further boosted by advancements in AI technology.  Large-scale cloud service providers called hyperscalers are racing to build AI infrastructure, with Amazon, Meta, Alphabet and Microsoft projected to spend over $360 billion in 2025, according to company filings.  Most of the investment is expected to go toward powering data centers.

headline: Digital Realty Trust (DLR) Surpasses Q3 FFO and Revenue Estimates
summary: Digital Realty Trust (DLR) delivered FFO and revenue surprises of +6.18% and +3.65%, respectively, for the quarter ended September 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Digital Realty Trust: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The Dallas-based real estate investment trust said it had funds from operations of $656 million, or $1.89 per share, in the period. The average estimate of seven analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for funds from operations of $1.78 per share. Funds from operations is a closely watched measure in the REIT industry.

headline: Digital Realty Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
summary: Digital Realty (NYSE: DLR), the largest global provider of cloud- and carrier-neutral data center, colocation and interconnection solutions, announced today financial results for the third quarter of 2025. All per share results are presented on a fully diluted basis.

headline: Prologis: Data Centers Could Meaningfully Accelerate Growth
summary: Prologis sees growth through rising logistics demand, rent upside, and expansion into high-margin data centers with solid fundamentals. See why PLD stock is a buy.

headline: Is Digital Realty Trust a Good Value After Recent Data Center Demand Surge?
summary: If you have Digital Realty Trust on your watchlist and are contemplating your next move, you are definitely not alone. Navigating this stock has kept investors talking, especially as its price action continues to spark debate. Looking at the past year, the stock has managed a 7.0% gain, even after some notable turbulence: a dip of 1.6% over the last week, and a 1.3% slip over the past month. Zooming out, those longer-term numbers still command attention, with a 91.2% return over three years...
